content.raw:
> I think we would also have to manually modify the configuration of [https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/\_dsl\_generate\_all\_dsls/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/) to pull from GitHub as well.

Right. All the _\_dsl\_\*_ seed jobs \(\_dsl\_gazebo, \__dsl_\_sdformat, etc\) were created manually and would need to change the configuration. A find \+ sed combo directly on the filesystem of the server that modifies configuration files can help with this.

Rest of the changes for DSL base classes looks good to me assuming that we are going to maintain the infrastructure of publishing Bitbucket status by now.

‌
content.html:

Right. All the _dsl_* seed jobs (_dsl_gazebo, _dsl_sdformat, etc) were created manually and would need to change the configuration. A find + sed combo directly on the filesystem of the server that modifies configuration files can help with this.

Rest of the changes for DSL base classes looks good to me assuming that we are going to maintain the infrastructure of publishing Bitbucket status by now.

content.raw:
> Code that needs migration?

* `./jenkins-scripts/cygwin/dsl/roscywgin_compilation.dsl`: I'm not sure if this code is actually used. I don't see it in the [_dsl_generate_all_dsls job](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/_dsl_generate_all_dsls/)
* `./jenkins-scripts/gazebo-one_liner-homebrew.bash`: that URL is what get.gazebosim.org points to, so this script could probably curl from get.gazebosim.org instead, as long as we remember to redirect get.gazebosim.org away from bitbucket to the new GitHub location.
* `manual-jenkins-script-launcher/*` I don't know what this subfolder is used for either, though it would be easy enough to change the URL here as well when the time is right
content.html:
Code that needs migration?

  • ./jenkins-scripts/cygwin/dsl/roscywgin_compilation.dsl: I'm not sure if this code is actually used. I don't see it in the _dsl_generate_all_dsls job
  • ./jenkins-scripts/gazebo-one_liner-homebrew.bash: that URL is what get.gazebosim.org points to, so this script could probably curl from get.gazebosim.org instead, as long as we remember to redirect get.gazebosim.org away from bitbucket to the new GitHub location.
  • manual-jenkins-script-launcher/* I don't know what this subfolder is used for either, though it would be easy enough to change the URL here as well when the time is right

content.raw:
> * `./jenkins-scripts/gazebo-one_liner-homebrew.bash`: that URL is what get.gazebosim.org points to, so this script could probably curl from get.gazebosim.org instead, as long as we remember to redirect get.gazebosim.org away from bitbucket to the new GitHub location.

it looks like get.gazebosim.org doesn't support https, which may be the reason that the test script points at bitbucket directly

it looks like get.gazebosim.org doesn't support https, which may be the reason that the test script points at bitbucket directly
